edu.lehigh.cse.lol

Class Animation

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.Animation

  • public class Animation
extends java.lang.Object
    Animation is a way of describing a set of images that can be used to do flip-book animation on any actor. Animations consist of the names of images, and the time that each should be shown.

    There are two ways to make an animation. The more powerful uses to() to chain together frame/duration pairs. The less powerful uses a constructor with more parameters to define the entire animation in equal-duration pieces.

    • Method Summary

      Add a step to an animation

      • to

        public Animation to(java.lang.String imgName,
                    long duration)
        Add a step to an animation
        Parameters:
        imgName - The name of the image to add to the animation
        duration - The time in milliseconds that this image should be shown
        Returns:
        the Animation, so that we can chain calls to "to()"
